alert.note: Alert for Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 2:37PM MST until January 06 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow and blowing snow. Snowfall accumulations close to 12 inches have occurred so far. Additional snow accumulations of up to 8 inches expected. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over South Pass. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected Friday with snow developing Friday night. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West, including South Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel over passes will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow is likely to significantly reduce visibility down to a tenth of a mile at times. People recreating in the backcountry could become disoriented.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
